page.title: 17 BEGUILDY POTTERY
page.content: Beguildy Pottery is in a cottage opposite Beguildy Church and was opened in 1984. Mr. Jim Galbraith is the potter. He makes jugs, cups and saucers, plant pots and vases. Cathy Taggart makes jewellery and sometimes vases. They use white china clay from Cornwall and brown clay from The Potteries in Staffordshire. Jim has two electric wheels for throwing his pots. He has a small electric-firing kiln in his workshop and he has also built a much bigger kiln outside. He experiments with different powders to decorate his pots in different ways. He sells his pottery in a shop in front of his workshop and he sells to dealers who come from different parts of the country. Some of his pottery is on display in the village shop. Jim and Cathy welcome visitors to the pottery for demonstrations.
